confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at approximately 2:50â€¯pm local time on 26â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Taiâ€¯Po, Hongâ€¯Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
Seven of the eight blocks in the 2,000â€‘unit complex were engulfed by the blaze.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
Firefighters rated the incident as a 5â€‘level fire and are conducting ongoing rescue and suppression operations.
